SEARCH
Module group.ims
Package group.ims.Models

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
group.ims.Models.Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
This class implements high-level controls over parts and products within the inventory management system.

    • addPart

      public static void addPart(Part newPart)
      This function adds a new Part object to the allParts ObservableList variable
      Parameters:
      newPart - a new Part object to add to the allParts ObservableList variable

    • addProduct

      public static void addProduct(Product newProduct)
      This function adds a new Product object to the allProducts ObservableList variable
      Parameters:
      newProduct - a new Product object to add to the allProducts ObservableList variable

    • lookupPart

      public static Part lookupPart(int partID)
      This function is not utilized by the program but conducts a simple search of parts within the allParts ObservableList variable to see if the provided partID matches with any existing partIDs.
      Parameters:
      partID - the partID that is used to search for matching partIDs within the allParts ObservableList variable.
      Returns:
      a Part with a matching partID or null.

    • lookupPart

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> lookupPart(String partName)
      This function is not utilized by the program but conducts a simple search of parts within the allParts ObservableList variable to see if the provided part name matches with any existing part names, or if portions of existing part names match with the provided input part name.
      Parameters:
      partName - the part name that is used to search for matching part names (or portions thereof) within the allParts ObservableList variable.
      Returns:
      a Part ObservableList with a matching part name (or portions thereof) or null.

    • lookupProduct

      public static Product lookupProduct(int productID)
      This function is not utilized by the program but conducts a simple search of products within the allProducts ObservableList variable to see if the provided productID matches with any existing productIDs.
      Parameters:
      productID - the productID that is used to search for matching productIDs within the allProducts ObservableList variable.
      Returns:
      a Product with a matching partID or null.

    • lookupProduct

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> lookupProduct(String productName)
      This function is not utilized by the program but conducts a simple search of products within the allProdcuts ObservableList variable to see if the provided product name matches with any existing product names, or if portions of existing product names match with the provided input product name.@return a Product ObservableList with a matching part name (or portions thereof) or null.
      Parameters:
      productName - the product name that is used to search for matching product names (or portions thereof) within the allProducts ObservableList variable.

    • updatePart

      public static void updatePart(int index, Part selectedPart)
      This function is not utilized by the program but could be implemented in a way which "updates" a part by removing the part from the allParts ObservableList variable and adds a new Part object (maintaining the same part ID) with updated information.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the part object within the allParts ObservableList variable to be "updated" (ultimately removed and replaced with a new Part object).
      selectedPart - the Part object that will be added to the allParts ObservableList variable to effectively replace the Part object that is being modified.

    • updateProduct

      public static void updateProduct(int index, Product newProduct)
      This function is not utilized by the program but could be implemented in a way which "updates" a product by removing the product from the allProducts ObservableList variable and adds a new Product object (maintaining the same part ID) with updated information.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the product object within the allProducts ObservableList variable to be "updated" (ultimately removed and replaced with a new Product object).
      newProduct - the Product object that will be added to the allParts ObservableList variable to effectively replace the Product object that is being modified.

    • deletePart

      public static boolean deletePart(Part selectedPart)
      This function is not utilized by the program but could be implemented in a way which deletes a selected part object from the allParts ObservableList variable.
      Parameters:
      selectedPart - the part to be removed from the allParts ObservableList variable
      Returns:
      a boolean "true" value

    • deleteProduct

      public static boolean deleteProduct(Product selectedProduct)
      This function is not utilized by the program but could be implemented in a way which deletes a selected product object from the allProducts ObservableList variable.
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - the part to be removed from the allParts ObservableList variable
      Returns:
      a boolean "true" value
